keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's will was signed on August 8, 2019, in New York, just over a month before his death.
The will appoints Darren K. Indyke and Richard D. Kahn as primary executors, with Boris Nikolic as a successor executor.
Epstein's entire estate is bequeathed to the trustees of 'The 1953 Trust', a trust agreement dated August 8, 2019.
Each executor is to be paid $250,000 upon completion of probate, with no other compensation for serving.
The will grants executors extremely broad powers to manage, invest, and dispose of estate assets without judicial oversight.
Jeffrey Epstein's Last Will and Testament was executed on August 8, 2019.
The will establishes a trust and appoints executors to administer the estate, with provisions for successor executors.
It contains a 'no-contest' clause, disinheriting any beneficiary who challenges the will or trust.
The document details complex tax provisions, including the apportionment of estate taxes for assets not passing under the will or trust.
The will incorporates by reference the provisions of a separate Trust Agreement existing at the time of Epstein's death.
